alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Carter; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 2:18AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnston, western Bryan, eastern Love, southeastern Carter, Marshall and southeastern Murray Counties through 245 AM CST... At 218 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Gene Autry to 4 miles north of Lebanon to 3 miles southeast of Thackerville. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph, pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Madill, Tishomingo, Marietta, Kingston, Dickson, Colbert, Mannsville, Springer, Ravia, Thackerville, Silo, Mill Creek, Milburn, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Mead, Cartwright, Fillmore and Reagan. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 1 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bryan; Carter; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray
